3 tips for landing a role at an early-stage startup:

#1 - Add value in your cold outreaches.

Nobody likes getting a request to "pick their brain". 

Instead, do research beforehand and share with the founders how you can add value.

#Business #Tip : As a startup CEO, it’s easy to get engrossed with the day to day activities of working IN your business. But it’s also critical to make time to work ON your business, reviewing regularly your strategy, long term plans, culture, policies and performance.

2 major tips if you want to break into Tech from another industry:

1. Find startups directly related to your former field (IE Finance > FinTech, Education > EdTech etc.). They’ll be more open to your background

Startup org design tip: 
1. Identify the most important goals/initiatives for the year ahead.
2. Ensure you have at least one person 100% dedicated to each. 
3. Make that person’s success directly tied to goal’s success. 

Easy recipe to get accountability and ownership.

Dynasty startup tip:
You’ll be more successful in a startup if you have lots of time available.

Time during the draft allows you to be:
-prepared
-monitor other owners
-active in trade talks
-take advantage of desperate owners
-build relationships, which will help down the line

Content marketing pro tip: not all organic traffic is of equal value. Using organic traffic growth as a KPI works in the beginning (3-6 months), but eventually your startup should focus on owning the highest intent keywords. Focus on $$ value per organic page session.

Michael's prev startup was built on the assumption that people wanted to customise their shoes. In reality, they wanted to buy recognised brands in Instagram. The customised market didn't exist, so they had to survey instead of observe, leading to the wrong conclusion.

Being a PM is hard, 💭

Here is a tip:
"Don't expect others to do well, until they're themselves expecting to do well"

Expectations don't generate results, real work, execution plans, status updates and deadlines do.

Fundraising tip: Ask founders that recently raised at your round to walk you through their pitch.

Note what they did well. Ex: how did they tell their story? What was compelling about it?

I did this when raising fund, but useful for startups too.
